name: FibrinDDimerInPlateletPoorPlasma
title: Fibrin D dimer in Platelet poor plasma
description: D-dimer (or D dimer) is a fibrin degradation product (or FDP), a small protein fragment present in the blood after a blood clot is degraded by fibrinolysis. It is so named because it contains two D fragments of the fibrin protein joined by a cross-link, hence forming a protein dimer.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: help rule out clotting (thrombotic) episodes and to help diagnose conditions related to thrombosis. Test is indicated when you have symptoms of a blood clot or a condition that causes inappropriate blood clots, such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT), pulmonary embolism (PE), or disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC), and to monitor treatment of DIC and excessive clotting conditions),(Data Element Scope: ),(Inclusion Criteria: ),(Exclusion Criteria: )
